headlineText: President Trump said there was a very, very good chance of a trade deal with China being reached when he meets with the Chinese president in March.
headlineTitle: U.S. and China Extend Talks, but Final Deal Remains Elusive

headlineText: Despite talk that the dollar was losing dominance, it has only gained stature, reinforcing President Trump's power to dictate foreign policy.
headlineTitle: The Dollar Is Still King. How (in the World) Did That Happen?

headlineText: The Fed released minutes of its January meeting showing officials continued to express confidence in the economy but saw enough warning signs to warrant a pause in rate increases.
headlineTitle: Fed Explains Pause as Officials Debate Future Rate Increases

headlineText: A proposal to tax wealth finds support across party lines, along with the premise that the government should combat inequality.
headlineTitle: Democrats Want to Tax the Wealthy. Many Voters Agree.

headlineText: A decline in residential real estate has led several recessions. With construction still in a multiyear slump, it seems unlikely to be the culprit this year.
headlineTitle: Housing Is Already in a Slump. So It (Probably) Can't Cause a Recession.

headlineText: There are other tools that don't involve quite the risks and challenges of targeting the richest families.
headlineTitle: Elizabeth Warren Wants a Wealth Tax. How Would That Even Work?

headlineText: Plus, tax season brings bad news, and the Fed offers more clues about its change of heart.
headlineTitle: The Week in Business: Amazon Breaks Up With New York, and Warren Buffett Takes Stock

headlineText: With millions of people filing tax returns under a new tax law and after a long government shutdown, this is a challenging year. We offer survival tips and extensive coverage.
headlineTitle: Watch Out. Tax Season Is Even More Stressful Than Usual.
